intro: Tragacantha ortholoba, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits.
